105126.markdown: No ([#105126](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/105126), [@sallyom](https://github.com/sallyom)) [SIG API Machinery, Apps, Architecture, CLI, Cloud Provider, Cluster Lifecycle, Instrumentation, Node, Release, Scheduling, Storage and Testing]
105126.author: sallyom

105919.text: As of v1.25, the PodSecurity `restricted` level no longer requires pods that set .spec.os.name="windows" to also set Linux-specific securityContext fields. If a 1.25+ cluster has unsupported [out-of-skew](https://kubernetes.io/releases/version-skew-policy/#kubelet) nodes prior to v1.23 and wants to ensure namespaces enforcing the `restricted` policy continue to require Linux-specific securityContext fields on all pods, ensure a version of the `restricted` prior to v1.25 is selected by labeling the namespace (for example, `pod-security.kubernetes.io/enforce-version: v1.24`)
105919.markdown: As of v1.25, the PodSecurity `restricted` level no longer requires pods that set .spec.os.name="windows" to also set Linux-specific securityContext fields. If a 1.25+ cluster has unsupported [out-of-skew](https://kubernetes.io/releases/version-skew-policy/#kubelet) nodes prior to v1.23 and wants to ensure namespaces enforcing the `restricted` policy continue to require Linux-specific securityContext fields on all pods, ensure a version of the `restricted` prior to v1.25 is selected by labeling the namespace (for example, `pod-security.kubernetes.io/enforce-version: v1.24`) ([#105919](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/105919), [@ravisantoshgudimetla](https://github.com/ravisantoshgudimetla))
105919.author: ravisantoshgudimetla

107490.text: kubelet: added log for volume metric collection taking too long
107490.markdown: Kubelet: added log for volume metric collection taking too long ([#107490](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/107490), [@pacoxu](https://github.com/pacoxu))
107490.author: pacoxu

108554.text: Added a deprecated warning for node beta label usage in PV/SC/RC and CSI Storage Capacity.
108554.markdown: Added a deprecated warning for node beta label usage in PV/SC/RC and CSI Storage Capacity. ([#108554](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/108554), [@pacoxu](https://github.com/pacoxu))
108554.author: pacoxu

108624.text: API server's deprecated `--service-account-api-audiences` flag was removed.  Use `--api-audiences` instead.

108624.author: ialidzhikov

109070.text: Shell completion is now provided for the "--subresource" flag.

109070.author: marckhouzam

109141.text: Default burst limit for the discovery client set to 300.
109141.markdown: Default burst limit for the discovery client set to 300. ([#109141](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109141), [@ulucinar](https://github.com/ulucinar))
109141.author: ulucinar

109217.text: Faster mount detection for linux kernel 5.10+ using openat2 speeding up pod churn rates. On Kernel versions less 5.10, it will fallback to using the original way of detecting mount points i.e by parsing /proc/mounts.
109217.markdown: Faster mount detection for linux kernel 5.10+ using openat2 speeding up pod churn rates. On Kernel versions less 5.10, it will fallback to using the original way of detecting mount points i.e by parsing /proc/mounts. ([#109217](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109217), [@manugupt1](https://github.com/manugupt1))
109217.author: manugupt1

109263.text: kubelet: added validation for labels provided with --node-labels. Malformed labels will result in errors.
109263.markdown: Kubelet: added validation for labels provided with --node-labels. Malformed labels will result in errors. ([#109263](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109263), [@FeLvi-zzz](https://github.com/FeLvi-zzz))
109263.author: FeLvi-zzz

109601.text: Fixed a bug which could have allowed an improperly annotated LoadBalancer service to become active.
109601.markdown: Fixed a bug which could have allowed an improperly annotated LoadBalancer service to become active. ([#109601](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109601), [@mdbooth](https://github.com/mdbooth))
109601.author: mdbooth

109706.text: Reduced the number of cloud API calls and service downtime caused by excessive re-configurations of cluster LBs with externalTrafficPolicy=Local when node readiness changes (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/111539). The service controller (in cloud-controller-manager) will avoid resyncing nodes which are transitioning between `Ready` / `NotReady` (only for for ETP=Local Services).  The LBs used for these services will solely rely on the health check probe defined by the `healthCheckNodePort` to determine if a particular node is to be used for traffic load balancing.
109706.markdown: Reduced the number of cloud API calls and service downtime caused by excessive re-configurations of cluster LBs with externalTrafficPolicy=Local when node readiness changes (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/111539). The service controller (in cloud-controller-manager) will avoid resyncing nodes which are transitioning between `Ready` / `NotReady` (only for for ETP=Local Services).  The LBs used for these services will solely rely on the health check probe defined by the `healthCheckNodePort` to determine if a particular node is to be used for traffic load balancing. ([#109706](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109706), [@alexanderConstantinescu](https://github.com/alexanderConstantinescu))
109706.author: alexanderConstantinescu

109819.text: Support for the alpha seccomp annotations `seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod` and `container.seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io`, deprecated since v1.19, was partially removed. Kubelets no longer support the annotations, use of the annotations in static pods is no longer supported, and the seccomp annotations are no longer auto-populated when pods with seccomp fields are created. Auto-population of the seccomp fields from the annotations is planned to be removed in 1.27. Pods  should use the corresponding pod or container `securityContext.seccompProfile` field instead.
109819.markdown: Support for the alpha seccomp annotations `seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io/pod` and `container.seccomp.security.alpha.kubernetes.io`, deprecated since v1.19, was partially removed. Kubelets no longer support the annotations, use of the annotations in static pods is no longer supported, and the seccomp annotations are no longer auto-populated when pods with seccomp fields are created. Auto-population of the seccomp fields from the annotations is planned to be removed in 1.27. Pods  should use the corresponding pod or container `securityContext.seccompProfile` field instead. ([#109819](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109819), [@saschagrunert](https://github.com/saschagrunert))
109819.author: saschagrunert

110007.text: Added new flags into alpha events such as --output, --types, --no-headers.
110007.markdown: Added new flags into alpha events such as --output, --types, --no-headers. ([#110007](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110007), [@ardaguclu](https://github.com/ardaguclu))
110007.author: ardaguclu

110164.text:
The `priority_level_request_utilization` metric histogram is adjusted so that for the cases where `phase=waiting` the denominator is the cumulative capacity of all of the priority level's queues.
 The `read_vs_write_current_requests` metric histogram is adjusted, in the case of using API Priority and Fairness instead of max-in-flight, to divide by the relevant limit: sum of queue capacities for waiting requests, sum of seat limits for executing requests.
110164.markdown:
The `priority_level_request_utilization` metric histogram is adjusted so that for the cases where `phase=waiting` the denominator is the cumulative capacity of all of the priority level's queues.
   The `read_vs_write_current_requests` metric histogram is adjusted, in the case of using API Priority and Fairness instead of max-in-flight, to divide by the relevant limit: sum of queue capacities for waiting requests, sum of seat limits for executing requests. ([#110164](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110164), [@MikeSpreitzer](https://github.com/MikeSpreitzer))
110164.author: MikeSpreitzer

110495.text: Changed ownership semantics of PersistentVolume's spec.claimRef from `atomic` to `granular`.
110495.markdown: Changed ownership semantics of PersistentVolume's spec.claimRef from `atomic` to `granular`. ([#110495](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110495), [@alexzielenski](https://github.com/alexzielenski))
110495.author: alexzielenski

110534.text:
Kube-Scheduler ComponentConfig is graduated to GA, `kubescheduler.config.k8s.io/v1` is available now. 
Plugin `SelectorSpread` is removed in v1.
110534.markdown:
Kube-Scheduler ComponentConfig is graduated to GA, `kubescheduler.config.k8s.io/v1` is available now. 
  Plugin `SelectorSpread` is removed in v1. ([#110534](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110534), [@kerthcet](https://github.com/kerthcet))

110688.author: jsafrane

110914.text: `pod.Spec.RuntimeClassName` field is now available in kubectl describe command.
110914.markdown: `pod.Spec.RuntimeClassName` field is now available in kubectl describe command. ([#110914](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110914), [@yeahdongcn](https://github.com/yeahdongcn))
110914.author: yeahdongcn

110940.text: The kubelet no longer supports collecting accelerator metrics through cAdvisor. The feature gate `DisableAcceleratorUsageMetrics` is now GA and cannot be disabled.

110940.author: pacoxu

110957.text: Windows winkernel kube-proxy no longer supports Windows HNS v1 APIs.
110957.markdown: Windows winkernel kube-proxy no longer supports Windows HNS v1 APIs. ([#110957](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110957), [@papagalu](https://github.com/papagalu))
110957.author: papagalu

110959.text:
Introduction of the `DisruptionTarget` pod condition type. Its `reason` field indicates the reason for pod termination:
- PreemptionByKubeScheduler (Pod preempted by kube-scheduler)
- DeletionByTaintManager (Pod deleted by taint manager due to NoExecute taint)
- EvictionByEvictionAPI (Pod evicted by Eviction API)
- DeletionByPodGC (an orphaned Pod deleted by PodGC)
110959.markdown:
Introduction of the `DisruptionTarget` pod condition type. Its `reason` field indicates the reason for pod termination:
  - PreemptionByKubeScheduler (Pod preempted by kube-scheduler)
  - DeletionByTaintManager (Pod deleted by taint manager due to NoExecute taint)
  - EvictionByEvictionAPI (Pod evicted by Eviction API)
  - DeletionByPodGC (an orphaned Pod deleted by PodGC) ([#110959](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/110959), [@mimowo](https://github.com/mimowo))
110959.author: mimowo

111009.text: UserName check for 'ContainerAdministrator' is now case-insensitive if runAsNonRoot is set to true on Windows.
111009.markdown: UserName check for 'ContainerAdministrator' is now case-insensitive if runAsNonRoot is set to true on Windows. ([#111009](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111009), [@marosset](https://github.com/marosset))
111009.author: marosset

111033.text: Metric `running_managed_controllers` is enabled for Cloud Node Lifecycle controller.
111033.markdown: Metric `running_managed_controllers` is enabled for Cloud Node Lifecycle controller. ([#111033](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111033), [@jprzychodzen](https://github.com/jprzychodzen))

111060.text: For Linux, `kube-proxy` uses a new “distroless” container image, instead of an image based on Debian.

111113.text: Introduced support for handling pod failures with respect to the configured pod failure policy rules.

111119.text: Encrypted data with DEK using AES-GCM instead of AES-CBC for kms data encryption. No user action required. Reads with AES-GCM and AES-CBC will continue to be allowed.

111119.author: aramase

111186.text: Fixed the GCE firewall update when the destination IPs are changing so that firewalls reflect the IP updates of the LBs.

111192.text: Added Service Account field in the output of `kubectl describe pod` command.

111192.author: aufarg

111194.text: Promoted DaemonSet MaxSurge to GA. This means `--feature-gates=DaemonSetUpdateSurge=true` are not needed on kube-apiserver and kube-controller-manager binaries and they'll be removed soon following policy at https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/using-api/deprecation-policy/#deprecation .
111194.markdown: Promoted DaemonSet MaxSurge to GA. This means `--feature-gates=DaemonSetUpdateSurge=true` are not needed on kube-apiserver and kube-controller-manager binaries and they'll be removed soon following policy at https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/using-api/deprecation-policy/#deprecation . ([#111194](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111194), [@ravisantoshgudimetla](https://github.com/ravisantoshgudimetla))

111229.text: The Pod `spec.podOS` field is promoted to GA. The `IdentifyPodOS` feature gate unconditionally enabled, and will no longer be accepted as a `--feature-gates` parameter in 1.27.

111254.text: For v1.25, Kubernetes will be using golang 1.19, In this PR the version is updated to 1.19rc2 as GA is not yet available.
111254.markdown: For v1.25, Kubernetes will be using golang 1.19, In this PR the version is updated to 1.19rc2 as GA is not yet available. ([#111254](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111254), [@dims](https://github.com/dims))
111254.author: dims

111255.text: vSphere releases less than 7.0u2 are not supported for in-tree vSphere volume  as of Kubernetes v1.25. Please consider upgrading vSphere (both ESXi and vCenter)  to 7.0u2 or above.
111255.markdown: VSphere releases less than 7.0u2 are not supported for in-tree vSphere volume  as of Kubernetes v1.25. Please consider upgrading vSphere (both ESXi and vCenter)  to 7.0u2 or above. 111255.author: divyenpatel

111278.text: Added a new `align-by-socket` policy option to cpu manager `static` policy.  When enabled CPU's to be aligned at socket boundary rather than NUMA boundary.
111278.markdown: Added a new `align-by-socket` policy option to cpu manager `static` policy.  When enabled CPU's to be aligned at socket boundary rather than NUMA boundary. ([#111278](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111278), [@arpitsardhana](https://github.com/arpitsardhana))
111278.author: arpitsardhana

111301.text: `CSIMigrationGCE` upgraded to GA and locked to true.
111301.markdown:
`CSIMigrationGCE` upgraded to GA and locked to true.
   ([#111301](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111301), [@mattcary](https://github.com/mattcary))
111301.author: mattcary

111319.text: The `kubectl diff` changed to ignore managed fields by default, and a new --show-managed-fields flag has been added to allow you to include managed fields in the diff.
111319.markdown: The `kubectl diff` changed to ignore managed fields by default, and a new --show-managed-fields flag has been added to allow you to include managed fields in the diff. ([#111319](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111319), [@brianpursley](https://github.com/brianpursley))
111319.author: brianpursley

111383.text: kubeadm: enabled the --experimental-watch-progress-notify-interval flag for etcd and set it to 5s. The flag specifies an interval at which etcd sends watch data to the kube-apiserver.
111383.markdown: Kubeadm: enabled the --experimental-watch-progress-notify-interval flag for etcd and set it to 5s. The flag specifies an interval at which etcd sends watch data to the kube-apiserver. ([#111383](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111383), [@p0lyn0mial](https://github.com/p0lyn0mial))
111383.author: p0lyn0mial

111399.text: The  new flag `etcd-ready-timeout` has been added. It configures a timeout of an additional etcd check performed as part of readyz check.
111399.markdown: The  new flag `etcd-ready-timeout` has been added. It configures a timeout of an additional etcd check performed as part of readyz check. ([#111399](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111399), [@Argh4k](https://github.com/Argh4k))
111399.author: Argh4k

111402.text: [Ephemeral Containers](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/ephemeral-containers/) are now generally available (GA). The `EphemeralContainers` feature gate is always enabled and should be removed from `--feature-gates` flag on the kube-apiserver and the kubelet command lines. The `EphemeralContainers` feature gate is [deprecated and scheduled for removal](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/using-api/deprecation-policy/#deprecation)  in a future release.
111402.markdown: [Ephemeral Containers](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/ephemeral-containers/) are now generally available (GA). The `EphemeralContainers` feature gate is always enabled and should be removed from `--feature-gates` flag on the kube-apiserver and the kubelet command lines. The `EphemeralContainers` feature gate is [deprecated and scheduled for removal](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/using-api/deprecation-policy/#deprecation)  in a future release. ([#111402](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111402), [@verb](https://github.com/verb))
111402.author: verb

111406.text: Updated max azure data disk count map with new VM types.
111406.markdown: Updated max azure data disk count map with new VM types. ([#111406](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111406), [@bennerv](https://github.com/bennerv))
111406.author: bennerv

111411.text: The command line flag `enable-taint-manager` for kube-controller-manager is deprecated and will be removed in 1.26. The feature that it supports, taint based eviction, is enabled by default and will continue to be implicitly enabled when the flag is removed.
111411.markdown: The command line flag `enable-taint-manager` for kube-controller-manager is deprecated and will be removed in 1.26. The feature that it supports, taint based eviction, is enabled by default and will continue to be implicitly enabled when the flag is removed. ([#111411](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111411), [@alculquicondor](https://github.com/alculquicondor))
111411.author: alculquicondor

111466.author: jprzychodzen

111467.text: PersistentVolumeClaim objects are no longer left with storage class set to `nil` forever, but will be updated retroactively once any StorageClass is set or created as default.
111467.markdown: PersistentVolumeClaim objects are no longer left with storage class set to `nil` forever, but will be updated retroactively once any StorageClass is set or created as default. ([#111467](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111467), [@RomanBednar](https://github.com/RomanBednar))
111467.author: RomanBednar

111472.text: The namespace editors and admins can now create leases.coordination.k8s.io and should use this type for leaderelection instead of configmaps.
111472.markdown: The namespace editors and admins can now create leases.coordination.k8s.io and should use this type for leaderelection instead of configmaps. ([#111472](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111472), [@deads2k](https://github.com/deads2k))
111472.author: deads2k

111475.text: If a Pod has a DisruptionTarget condition with status=True for more than 2 minutes without getting a DeletionTimestamp, the control plane resets it to status=False.
111475.markdown: If a Pod has a DisruptionTarget condition with status=True for more than 2 minutes without getting a DeletionTimestamp, the control plane resets it to status=False. ([#111475](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111475), [@alculquicondor](https://github.com/alculquicondor))

111481.markdown: Added e2e test flag to specify which volume drivers should be installed. This  deprecated the ENABLE_STORAGE_GCE_PD_DRIVER environment variable. ([#111481](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111481), [@mattcary](https://github.com/mattcary))
111481.author: mattcary

111485.text: GlusterFS provisioner (`kubernetes.io/glusterfs`) has been deprecated in this release.
111485.markdown: GlusterFS provisioner (`kubernetes.io/glusterfs`) has been deprecated in this release. ([#111485](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111485), [@humblec](https://github.com/humblec))
111485.author: humblec

111507.text: New flag `--disable-compression-for-client-ips` can be used to control client address ranges for which traffic shouldn't be compressed.
111507.markdown: New flag `--disable-compression-for-client-ips` can be used to control client address ranges for which traffic shouldn't be compressed. ([#111507](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111507), [@mborsz](https://github.com/mborsz))
111507.author: mborsz

111513.text: Local Storage Capacity Isolation feature is GA in 1.25 release. For systems (rootless) that cannot check root file system, please use kubelet config --local-storage-capacity-isolation=false to disable this feature. Once disabled, pod cannot set local ephemeral storage request/limit, and emptyDir sizeLimit niether.
111513.markdown: Local Storage Capacity Isolation feature is GA in 1.25 release. For systems (rootless) that cannot check root file system, please use kubelet config --local-storage-capacity-isolation=false to disable this feature. Once disabled, pod cannot set local ephemeral storage request/limit, and emptyDir sizeLimit niether. ([#111513](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111513), [@jingxu97](https://github.com/jingxu97))
111513.author: jingxu97

111524.text: Graduated `CustomResourceValidationExpressions` to `beta`. The `CustomResourceValidationExpressions` feature gate is now enabled by default.
111524.markdown: Graduated `CustomResourceValidationExpressions` to `beta`. The `CustomResourceValidationExpressions` feature gate is now enabled by default. ([#111524](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111524), [@cici37](https://github.com/cici37))
111524.author: cici37

111547.text: The kube-scheduler ComponentConfig v1beta2 is deprecated in v1.25.
111547.markdown: The kube-scheduler ComponentConfig v1beta2 is deprecated in v1.25. ([#111547](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111547), [@kerthcet](https://github.com/kerthcet))
111547.author: kerthcet

111557.text: Fixed performance issue when creating large objects using SSA with fully unspecified schemas ( preserveUnknownFields ).
111557.markdown: Fixed performance issue when creating large objects using SSA with fully unspecified schemas ( preserveUnknownFields ). ([#111557](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111557), [@alexzielenski](https://github.com/alexzielenski))
111557.author: alexzielenski

111606.text:
Upgraded functionality of `kubectl kustomize` as described at
https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize/releases/tag/kustomize%2Fv4.5.7.
111606.markdown:
Upgraded functionality of `kubectl kustomize` as described at
  https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize/releases/tag/kustomize%2Fv4.5.7. ([#111606](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111606), [@natasha41575](https://github.com/natasha41575))
111606.author: natasha41575

111618.text: The intree volume plugin flocker support was completely removed from Kubernetes.
111618.markdown: The intree volume plugin flocker support was completely removed from Kubernetes. ([#111618](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111618), [@Jiawei0227](https://github.com/Jiawei0227))
111618.author: Jiawei0227

111619.text: The intree volume plugin quobyte support has been completely removed from Kubernetes.
111619.markdown: The intree volume plugin quobyte support has been completely removed from Kubernetes. ([#111619](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111619), [@Jiawei0227](https://github.com/Jiawei0227))
111619.author: Jiawei0227

111620.text: The intree volume plugin storageos support has been completely removed from Kubernetes.
111620.markdown: The intree volume plugin storageos support has been completely removed from Kubernetes. ([#111620](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111620), [@Jiawei0227](https://github.com/Jiawei0227))
111620.author: Jiawei0227

111633.text: ginkgo: when e2e tests are invoked through ginkgo-e2e.sh, the default now is to use color escape sequences only when connected to a terminal. `GINKGO_NO_COLOR=y/n` can be used to override that default.
111633.markdown: Ginkgo: when e2e tests are invoked through ginkgo-e2e.sh, the default now is to use color escape sequences only when connected to a terminal. `GINKGO_NO_COLOR=y/n` can be used to override that default. ([#111633](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111633), [@pohly](https://github.com/pohly))
111633.author: pohly

111645.text:
Extended ContainerStatus CRI API to allow runtime response with container resource requests and limits that are in effect.
- UpdateContainerResources CRI API now supports both Linux and Windows.
111645.markdown:
Extended ContainerStatus CRI API to allow runtime response with container resource requests and limits that are in effect.
  - UpdateContainerResources CRI API now supports both Linux and Windows. ([#111645](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111645), [@vinaykul](https://github.com/vinaykul))
111645.author: vinaykul

111646.text: Fixed JobTrackingWithFinalizers when a pod succeeds after the job is considered failed, which led to API conflicts that blocked finishing the job.
111646.markdown: Fixed JobTrackingWithFinalizers when a pod succeeds after the job is considered failed, which led to API conflicts that blocked finishing the job. ([#111646](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111646), [@alculquicondor](https://github.com/alculquicondor))
111646.author: alculquicondor

111679.text: Kubernetes is now built with go 1.19.0.
111679.markdown: Kubernetes is now built with go 1.19.0. ([#111679](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111679), [@puerco](https://github.com/puerco))
111679.author: puerco

111691.text: Removed the recently re-introduced schedulability predicate ([#109706](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109706)) as to not have unschedulable nodes removed from load balancers back-end pools.
111691.markdown: Removed the recently re-introduced schedulability predicate ([#109706](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/109706)) as to not have unschedulable nodes removed from load balancers back-end pools. ([#111691](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/111691), [@alexanderConstantinescu](https://github.com/alexanderConstantinescu))
111691.author: alexanderConstantinescu
